channel.title: Python Reference on Protocol Buffers Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Python Reference on Protocol Buffers Documentation

item.title: Python Generated Code Guide
item.description: Any differences between proto2, proto3, and Editions generated code are highlighted - note that these differences are in the generated code as described in this document, not the base message classes/interfaces, which are the same across all versions. You should read the proto2 language guide, proto3 language guide, and/or Editions guide before reading this document. The Python Protocol Buffers implementation is a little different from C++ and Java. In Python, the compiler only outputs code to build descriptors for the generated classes, and a Python metaclass does the real work.
